revised_title: Obituary of Sir John Hawkshaw and W.P. Peter Martin Duncan
tldr: This article is an obituary for Sir John Hawkshaw, a prominent civil engineer, and W.P. Peter Martin Duncan, a geologist and palaeontologist. The article highlights their accomplishments, contributions to their respective fields, and their roles in the Royal Society. Sir John Hawkshaw was known for his work on railway engineering, while W.P. Peter Martin Duncan was a notable figure in the study of fossil corals and held professorships in geology.
